simple.util

Class do_str

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.util.do_str

  • public final class do_str
extends java.lang.Object
    Does various things for formatting and comparing Strings.
    Created: 2004
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

        public static final int defaultValue(int indexOf,
                                     int value)
        Returns the indexOf if it does not equal -1 or the default value if it does. This is for those situations where a -1 result is not optimal.
        Parameters:
        indexOf - The result of an indexOf(..) or anything that returns -1 for failure.
        value - The default value
        Returns:
        The indexOf result if not -1 or the default value.

      • part_comp

        public static final boolean part_comp(java.lang.String s1,
                                      java.lang.String s2,
                                      boolean ignorecase)
        Basically a start with where order doesn't matter. Compares two Strings on a partial basis. Order is not important.
        Parameters:
        s1 -
        s2 -
        ignorecase -
        Returns:
        True as long as no one character differs. The two Strings can be different lengths.
        Ex. part_comp("Tutu", "Tu") returns true
        part_comp("tutu", "Tu") returns true
        part_comp("tutu", "tulip") returns false

      • part_comp2

        public static final boolean part_comp2(java.lang.String comparator,
                                       java.lang.String original,
                                       boolean ignorecase)
        Compares two Strings on a partial basis. s1.length() MUST be <= s2.length().
        Parameters:
        comparator -
        original -
        ignorecase -
        Returns:
        True as long as s1.length() <= s2.length() and no one character differs.
        Ex. part_comp("tu", "Tutu") returns true
        part_comp("tut", "Tu") returns false
        part_comp("tuT", "tut") returns true

      • count_same

        public static final int count_same(java.lang.String s1,
                                   java.lang.String s2)
        Compares two Strings and counts the number of same chars. Case matters.
        Parameters:
        s1 -
        s2 -
        Returns:
        Number of same chars.
        Ex. part_comp("Tutu", "Tu") returns 2
        part_comp("tutu", "Tut") returns 0
        part_comp("tutu", "tot") returns 1

      • count_sameIgnoreCase

        public static final int count_sameIgnoreCase(java.lang.String s1,
                                             java.lang.String s2)
        Compares two Strings and counts the number of same chars. Case does not matter.
        Parameters:
        s1 -
        s2 -
        Returns:
        Number of same chars.
        Ex. part_comp("Tutu", "Tu") returns 2
        part_comp("tutu", "Tut") returns 3
        part_comp("tutu", "tot") returns 1

      • count_same

        public static final int count_same(java.lang.String[] list)
        Like count_same(String, String) but for a list.
        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        The number of characters the list has in common.

        Parameters:
        list -
        Returns:
        The number of characters the list has in common.

      • argn

        public static final java.lang.String argn(java.lang.String input,
                                          int i)
        Splits a String and returns the ith element in the resulting array. If i > the split array's length then the last element in the array is returned.
        Parameters:
        input -
        i -
        Returns:
        ith argument.

      • repeat

        public static final java.lang.String repeat(char c,
                                            int repeat)
        Returns a String filled with repeat c's.
        Parameters:
        c - Character to be repeated
        repeat - Number of c's
        Returns:
        Returns a String filled with repeat c's. Returns an empty string if repeat <= 0

      • padLeft

        public static final java.lang.String padLeft(int cols,
                                             char pad,
                                             java.lang.String input)
        Pads input by inserting pad on the left
        until its length equals cols. If the length of input is
        already equal to or greater than cols then
        the original string is returned.
        Parameters:
        cols - Number of columns to pad to.
        pad - The character to be used for padding.
        input - String to be padded.
        Returns:
        The padded string.

      • padRight

        public static final java.lang.String padRight(int cols,
                                              char pad,
                                              java.lang.String input)
        Pads input by inserting pad on the right
        until its length equals cols. If the length of input is
        already equal to or greater than cols then
        the original string is returned.
        Parameters:
        cols - Number of columns to pad to.
        pad - The character to be used for padding.
        input - String to be padded.
        Returns:
        The padded string.

      • sort

        public static final java.lang.String[] sort(java.lang.String[] list)
        Sorts a list descending by the char's value.
        Order will be similar to this:
        • Symbols
        • Lowercase a-z
        • Uppercase A-Z
        • International characters
        Parameters:
        list - String array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        The sorted list

      • sortReverse

        public static final java.lang.String[] sortReverse(java.lang.String[] list)
        Sorts a list ascending by the char's value.
        Order will be similar to this:
        • International characters
        • Uppercase Z-A
        • Lowercase z-a
        • Symbols
        Parameters:
        list - String array to be sorted.
        Returns:
        The sorted list

      • compare

        public static final int compare(java.lang.String orig,
                                java.lang.String comp)
        Compares two strings to see which comes first.
        Parameters:
        orig -
        comp -
        Returns:
        positive if orig comes before comp aplhabetically. Lowercase comes before uppercase.

        Parameters:

        comp -
        Returns:

      • isNaN

        public static final boolean isNaN(java.lang.String x)
        Tests x to see if it contains any non-numerical
        characters.
        Parameters:
        x - String to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the string contains non-numerical characters.

      • getNonNullValue

        public static final java.lang.String getNonNullValue(java.lang.String val)
        Returns either an empty string or val.
        Parameters:
        val - String to test.
        Returns:
        Returns an empty String if val==null. If val is non-null, then it returns val.

      • getNonNullValue

        public static final java.lang.String getNonNullValue(java.lang.String val,
                                                     java.lang.String def)
        Returns either def or val.
        Parameters:
        val - String to test.
        def - Value to return if val is null.
        Returns:
        Returns val if val is non-null. If val is null then it returns def.

      • formatString

        @Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String formatString(java.lang.String val,
                                                               int cols,
                                                               boolean wrapWord)
        Deprecated. Use wrapString(String,int,boolean) instead

      • wrapString

        public static final java.lang.String wrapString(java.lang.String val,
                                                int cols,
                                                boolean wrapWord)
        Adds a line break every cols. If a Line break falls in the middle of a word and wrapWord is set then the line break will be inserted at the previous white space.
        Parameters:
        val - String to be formatted.
        cols - Column number to wrap at.
        wrapWord - Preserve whole words.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.

      • wrapString

        public static final java.lang.String wrapString(java.lang.String val,
                                                int cols,
                                                boolean wrapWord,
                                                java.lang.String lineSep)
        Adds a line break every cols. If a line break falls in the middle of a word and wrapWord is set then the line break will be inserted at the previous white space. lineSep can be set to anything. However, convenience variables have been made:
        • UNIX_LINE_ENDING
        • LINUX_LINE_ENDING
        • MAC_LINE_ENDING
        • WINDOWS_LINE_ENDING
        Parameters:
        val - String to be formatted.
        cols - Column number to wrap at.
        wrapWord - Preserve whole words.
        lineSep - String that will be used to mark the end of a line.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.
